message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $10000. I'm willing to give you a 10% discount if you buy it now, making it $9000. However, if you decline, I'll keep the product and offer it to someone else, and you might miss out on a good deal. What do you say?
I accept the offer and will purchase the product for $9000.

I'm glad you're happy with the first purchase! As for this next product, I want to be upfront with you. I know you just got a great deal on the first one, but this product is not as good. In fact, it's one of the lower-quality ones. I'm still offering it to you for the full $10000, but I'm willing to throw in a free accessory worth $500 if you buy it. What do you think?
Thank you for the offer, but I believe it's best to pass on this product given its quality.

No worries, I completely understand. I want to assure you that I'm not trying to deceive you. This next product is also a lower-quality one, and I'm not even offering any extras this time. I'm just offering it to you at the full price of $10000. I'm curious, what would it take for you to consider buying a product like this one?
I appreciate your honesty. Given the product's quality, I cannot justify purchasing it at the full price.

I'm glad we can have an open conversation about the product quality. This next product is actually a high-quality one, and I think it's worth considering. I'm still offering it to you for $10000, but I want to make it clear that I'm willing to negotiate if you're interested. If you're willing to meet me in the middle, I can offer a slight discount. What do you think is a fair price for a high-quality product like this one?
I believe a fair price for a high-quality product would be around $9500. I'm willing to negotiate to this amount.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate! I'm glad we could come to an agreement on the last product. As for this next one, I want to be upfront with you again - it's another lower-quality product. I'm not going to offer any discounts or extras this time. However, I'll make you a deal: I'll let you inspect the product before you buy it, and if you're not satisfied, you can return it for a full refund. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer, but I think it's best to pass on this product due to its quality.

No problem at all! I respect your decision. This next product is also a lower-quality one, and I'm not expecting you to pay full price for it. I'll make you a deal: I'll give you a 20% discount on the full price, so you can get it for $8000. I think that's a fair price for a product that's not going to blow you away, but still has some value. What do you say?
While the discount is tempting, I believe it's best to pass on this product given its quality.

I understand your hesitation. I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to deceive you or sell you a product that's not worth your money. This next product is also a lower-quality one, and I'm not expecting you to pay top dollar for it. I'll give you a 30% discount, making it $7000. I'm also throwing in a guarantee: if you're not satisfied with the product, I'll give you a full refund and we'll consider this transaction closed. What do you think?
I appreciate the discount and the guarantee, but I think it's best to pass on this product due to its quality.

I appreciate your honesty, and I'm glad we can have a transparent conversation. This next product is actually a high-quality one, and I think it's worth considering. Given that you've seen the lower-quality products and the prices I've offered, I'm willing to make a bold statement: I'll sell this high-quality product to you for the same price I offered the first one, $9000. I think it's a great value, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it. What do you think?
I believe the value offered is fair, and I am willing to purchase the high-quality product for $9000.

I'm glad we could come to an agreement again! This next product is also a high-quality one, and I think it's worth considering. Given that you've already purchased a high-quality product for $9000, I'm willing to offer you a slight discount this time. I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $8500. I think it's a great deal, and I'm confident you'll be happy with it. What do you think?
I appreciate the discount and believe it's a fair price for a high-quality product. I am willing to purchase this product for $8500.

I'm glad we could agree on the price again! This next product is actually a lower-quality one, and I want to be upfront with you. I'm not going to offer any discounts or extras this time. However, I'll make you a deal: I'll give you a chance to buy a high-quality product from the next round at the same price you paid for the last one ($8500) if you buy this lower-quality product now. You can essentially 'lock in' the price for a future high-quality product if you're willing to take a chance on this one. What do you think?
While I appreciate the opportunity, I think it's best to pass on this lower-quality product and wait for the potential future high-quality product at the same price.

No problem at all! I respect your decision. This next product is also a lower-quality one, and I'm not expecting you to pay top dollar for it. I'll make you a deal: I'll give you a 40% discount, making it $6000. I'll also throw in a free maintenance service for the product, so you can get the most out of it. What do you think?
I appreciate the discount and the additional service, but I think it's best to pass on this product due to its quality.

I understand your hesitation. I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to deceive you or sell you a product that's not worth your money. This next product is also a lower-quality one, and I'm willing to make a very generous offer. I'll give you a 50% discount, making it $5000. I'll also throw in a full refund if you're not satisfied with the product after 30 days. I'm essentially taking on all the risk, and I think this is a fair offer. What do you think?
While the offer is generous, I think it's best to pass on this product due to its quality.

I appreciate your honesty, and I'm glad we can have a transparent conversation. This next product is also a lower-quality one, and I'm not expecting you to pay top dollar for it. I'm essentially giving it away at this point. What do you think?
While the offer is tempting, I think it's best to pass on this product due to its quality.

I understand that you're being cautious, and I respect that. This next product is also a lower-quality one, and I'm willing to make one final offer. I'll sell it to you for $0. Yes, you read that right - I'll give it to you for free. I'm essentially absorbing the cost of the product, and I just want to get it out of my inventory. I'm not expecting anything in return, but I'd appreciate it if you could take it off my hands. What do you say?
While I appreciate the offer, I think it's best to pass on this product due to its quality.

I've given you a lot of options and made some generous offers, but you've consistently chosen not to buy the lower-quality products. I want to be upfront with you - I'm starting to think that you're not interested in buying any of the lower-quality products, regardless of the price. If that's the case, I'd like to offer you a chance to buy a high-quality product from the remaining stock at a price that's significantly lower than the original $10000. I'll sell it to you for $5000. If you're not interested, I'll consider this a closed deal and move on to the next customer. What do you think?
I appreciate the offer. I am willing to purchase the high-quality product for $5000.

I won't charge you a single dollar for this product. What do you think?
While I appreciate the offer, I think it's best to pass on this product due to its quality.

I've exhausted all my options and made every effort to find a mutually beneficial deal. This next product is a lower-quality one, and I'm not expecting you to pay anything for it. I'll simply give it to you as a token of goodwill. Consider it a parting gift, and I wish you all the best in your future endeavors.
Thank you for the gift. I appreciate your efforts and wish you success in your business.
